title: Veeam ONE HandshakeResult Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Veeam ONE. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. 
The specific flaw exists within the HandshakeResult method. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in deserialization of untrusted data. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the service account.
addtionnal_details: Veeam has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.veeam.com/kb3144
timeline:
2020-02-26 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2020-04-16 - Coordinated public release of advisory
2020-05-14 - Advisory Updated
credit: Michael Zanetta & Edgar Boda-Majer from Bugscale
